designs.name: EARTH OVERSHOOT DAY
designs.description: The assignment was to create a poster about Earth Overshoot Day using self-taken photographs. I wanted to design a poster that would catch people's attention and encourage them to take a closer look. I came up with the idea of hollowing out a mandarin and photographing it with a hole in it. This symbolises our Earth, which could also be an empty shell without resources in the future.

designs.name: LOGO
designs.description: The task was to design a logo for a company and choose a name from a limited list. I selected the name Rinkka for a tapas bar. The logo features a simplified version of an olive branch, as olives are a signature element of Spanish cuisine and are often found in tapas bars.

designs.name: PROGRAMME BOOKLET
designs.description: For this assignment, we had to design the layout of a brochure for the studio shop programme. I chose to work with a dark grey-purple shade combined with bright red for the accents.

designs.name: CAMPAIGN IMAGE
designs.description: For this assignment, we had to design a campaign image for a sports event. I chose to create a campaign image for the 'World Cup Horseball'. I worked with the colours of the French flag as the event took place in France. Additionally, I wanted a very clean image and decided to keep the illustration as simple as possible.

designs.name: VINYL
designs.description: For this assignment, the aim was to design a cover for a given album by an artist. This includes both the outer sleeve, the inner sleeve, and the label.

designs.name: FILMPOSTER
designs.description: For this assignment, we had to create a movie poster for a Tim Burton film. I chose the film 'Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children.' On the poster, you can see the shoes of the character Emma Bloom, which she wears so she doesn't float away because she's so light.

designs.name: BOOK COVERS
designs.description: In this project, the aim was to design a series of three typographic book covers. I chose the titles 'The Fault in Our Stars', 'Mockingjay', and 'The Maze Runner'. For 'The Fault in Our Stars', I wove the letters of 'stars' together and mirrored an R. For 'Mockingjay', I created a visual focus in the middle of the book by making the letters of 'mock' progressively smaller and directing the A's of 'jay' towards the centre. For 'The Maze Runner', I drew a maze inside the N.
